IDS.name: actuator
IDS.documentation: Generic simple description of a heating/current drive actuator, for a first simplified version of the Plasma Simulator component

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: status_of
field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.name: comment_of
field.documentation: Any additional comment from the source application

field.name: creator_of
field.documentation: Creator of this consistent IDS

field.name: date_of
field.documentation: Date of consistent creation of this IDS

field.name: source_of
field.documentation: Where do the data for this IDS come from (a procedure, a set of codes)

field.name: reference_of
field.documentation: Documented reference to this IDS data

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the actuator (IC, EC, NBI, LH)

field.name: channels
field.documentation: ID of the multiple channels of the actuator: Beam boxes for NBI, EC or IC launcher, ...

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power delivered at the output of the actuator, in the vessel (NB this is before the coupling / beam blocking / shine through / orbit losses calculations)

field.name: generic_dynamic
field.documentation: Generic 2D dynamic slot for storing an actuator control parameter (e.g. the angle of an ECRH mirror)

field.name: code
field.documentation: Generic decription of the code specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: version
field.documentation: Version of the code

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

field.name: output_diagnostics
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output in XML format

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: status_of
field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.name: comment_of

field.name: date_of

field.name: source_of
field.documentation: Where do the data for this IDS come from (a procedure, a set of codes)

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: linear_controller
field.documentation: A linear controller, this is rather conventional

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of this controller

field.name: description
field.documentation: Description of this controller

field.name: class
field.documentation: One of a known class of controllers

field.name: input_names
field.documentation: Names of the input signals, following the SDN convention

field.name: output_names
field.documentation: Names of the output signals following the SDN convention

field.name: statespace
field.documentation: Statespace controller in discrete or continuous time

field.name: a
field.documentation: A matrix

field.name: b
field.documentation: B matrix

field.name: c
field.documentation: C matrix

field.name: d
field.documentation: D matrix

field.name: deltat
field.documentation: Discrete time sampling interval ; if less than 1e-10, the controller is considered to be expressed in continuous time

field.name: pid
field.documentation: Filtered PID controller

field.name: p
field.documentation: Proportional term

field.name: i
field.documentation: Integral term

field.name: d
field.documentation: Derivative term

field.name: tau
field.documentation: Filter time-constant for the D-term

field.name: inputs
field.documentation: Input signals; the timebase is common to inputs and outputs for any particular controller

field.name: data
field.documentation: Input signals; the timebase is common to inputs and outputs for any particular controller

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: outputs
field.documentation: Output signals; the timebase is common to inputs and outputs for any particular controller

field.name: data
field.documentation: Output signals; the timebase is common to inputs and outputs for any particular controller

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: nonlinear_controller
field.documentation: A non-linear controller, this is less conventional and will have to be developed

field.documentation: Name of this controller

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: status_of
field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.name: comment_of
field.documentation: Any additional comment from the source application

field.name: creator_of
field.documentation: Creator of this consistent IDS

field.name: date_of
field.documentation: Date of consistent creation of this IDS

field.name: source_of
field.documentation: Where do the data for this IDS come from (a procedure, a set of codes)

field.name: reference_of
field.documentation: Documented reference to this IDS data

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation)

field.name: vacuum_toroidal_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal magnetic flux

field.name: t_e
field.documentation: Electron temperature

field.name: t_i_average
field.documentation: Ion temperature (averaged on charge states and ion species)

field.name: n_e
field.documentation: Electron density (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: n_e_fast
field.documentation: Density of fast (non-thermal) electrons

field.name: ions
field.documentation: Quantities related to the different ion species

field.name: a
field.documentation: Mass of atom

field.name: z_ion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed)

field.name: z_n
field.documentation: Nuclear charge

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

field.name: n_i
field.documentation: Ion density (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: n_i_fast
field.documentation: Density of fast (non-thermal) ions, for the ion species considered

field.name: t_i
field.documentation: Ion temperature of that ion species

field.name: p_i
field.documentation: Ion pressure for that ion species

field.name: v_tor_i
field.documentation: Toroidal velocity of that ion species

field.name: v_pol_i
field.documentation: Poloidal velocity of that ion species

field.name: multiple_charge_state_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in the Charge_States structure

field.name: charge_states
field.documentation: Quantities related to the different charge states of the ion species

field.name: z_min
field.documentation: Minimum Z of the charge state bundle

field.name: z_max
field.documentation: Maximum Z of the charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying charge state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: n_z
field.documentation: Density of the charge state considered (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: n_z_fast
field.documentation: Density of fast (non-thermal) ions, for the charge state considered

field.name: t_z
field.documentation: Temperature of the charge state considered

field.name: v_tor_z
field.documentation: Toroidal velocity of the charge state considered

field.name: v_pol_z
field.documentation: Poloidal velocity of the charge state considered

field.name: n_i_total_over_n_e
field.documentation: Ratio of total ion density (sum over species and charge states) over electron density. (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: momentum_tor
field.documentation: Total plasma toroidal momentum, summed over ion species and electrons

field.name: zeff
field.documentation: Effective charge

field.name: p_e
field.documentation: Electron pressure

field.name: p_i_total
field.documentation: Total ion pressure (sum over the ion species)

field.name: pressure_thermal
field.documentation: Thermal pressure (electrons+ions)

field.name: pressure_perpendicular
field.documentation: Total perpendicular pressure (electrons+ions, thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: pressure_parallel
field.documentation: Total parallel pressure (electrons+ions, thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: j_total
field.documentation: Total parallel current density = average(jtot.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_tor
field.documentation: Total toroidal current density = average(J_Tor/R) / average(1/R)

field.name: j_ohmic
field.documentation: Ohmic parallel current density = average(J_Ohmic.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_non_inductive
field.documentation: Non-inductive (includes bootstrap) parallel current density = average(jni.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_bootstrap
field.documentation: Bootstrap parallel current density = average(J_Bootstrap.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: conductivity_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel conductivity

field.name: e_field_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel electric field = average(E.B) / B0, where Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: q
field.documentation: Safety factor

field.name: magnetic_shear
field.documentation: Magnetic shear

field.name: global_quantities
field.documentation: Various global quantities derived from the Core_Profiles

field.name: ip
field.documentation: Total plasma current

field.name: current_non_inductive
field.documentation: Total non-inductive parallel current

field.name: current_bootstrap
field.documentation: Bootstrap parallel current

field.name: v_loop
field.documentation: LCFS loop voltage

field.name: li_3
field.documentation: Internal inductance

field.name: beta_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal beta (ratio of kinetic to magnetic pressure)

field.name: beta_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal beta

field.name: beta_pol
field.documentation: Poloidal beta

field.name: energy_diamagnetic
field.documentation: Plasma energy content = 3/2 * int(p,dV) with p being the total pressure (Pressure_Thermal + Pressure_Perpendicular)

field.name: code
field.documentation: Generic decription of the code specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: version
field.documentation: Version of the code

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

field.name: output_diagnostics
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output in XML format

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

IDS.name: core_sources
IDS.documentation: Core plasma source terms (for the transport equations)

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation)

field.name: vacuum_toroidal_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in Rho_Tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

field.name: actuator
field.documentation: Source is described by a combination of various actuators. All actuators provide their values on the same rho_tor_norm and time grids.

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the actuator

field.name: conductivity_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel conductivity induced by this actuator

field.name: n_e_source
field.documentation: Source term for electron density equation

field.name: t_e_source
field.documentation: Source term for electron energy equation

field.name: t_i_average_source
field.documentation: Source term for the total ion energy equation

field.name: momentum_tor_source
field.documentation: Source term for total toroidal momentum equation

field.name: ions
field.documentation: Source terms related to the different ions species

field.name: a
field.documentation: Mass of atom

field.name: z_ion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed)

field.name: z_n
field.documentation: Nuclear charge

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

field.name: n_i_source
field.documentation: Source term for ion density equation

field.name: t_i_source
field.documentation: Source term for the ion energy transport equation.

field.name: multiple_charge_state_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in the Charge_States structure

field.name: charge_states
field.documentation: Source terms related to the different charge states of the ion species

field.name: z_min
field.documentation: Minimum Z of the charge state bundle

field.name: z_max
field.documentation: Maximum Z of the charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying charge state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: n_z_source
field.documentation: Density of the charge state considered (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: t_z_source
field.documentation: Temperature of the charge state considered

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation)

field.name: vacuum_toroidal_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in Rho_Tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

field.name: model
field.documentation: Transport is described by a combination of various transport models. All models provide their values on the same rho_tor_norm and time grids.

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the transport model

field.name: conductivity_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel conductivity

field.name: n_e_transport
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for electron density equation

field.name: d
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity. The 2nd index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions.

field.name: v
field.documentation: Effective convection. The 2nd index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions.

field.name: t_e_transport
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for electron energy equation

field.name: d
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity

field.name: v
field.documentation: Effective convection

field.name: t_i_average_transport
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for averaged (over ion species) ion energy equation

field.name: d
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity

field.name: v
field.documentation: Effective convection

field.name: momentum_tor_transport
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for total toroidal momentum equation

field.name: d
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity

field.name: v
field.documentation: Effective convection

field.name: ions
field.documentation: Transport coefficients related to the different ions species

field.name: a
field.documentation: Mass of atom

field.name: z_ion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed)

field.name: z_n
field.documentation: Nuclear charge

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

field.name: n_i_transport
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for ion density equation

field.name: d
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity. The 2nd index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions.

field.name: v
field.documentation: Effective convection. The 2nd index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions.

field.name: t_i_transport
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for ion energy equation

field.name: d
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity

field.name: v
field.documentation: Effective convection

field.name: multiple_charge_state_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in the Charge_States structure

field.name: charge_states
field.documentation: Transport coefficients related to the different charge states of the ion species

field.name: z_min
field.documentation: Minimum Z of the charge state bundle

field.name: z_max
field.documentation: Maximum Z of the charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying charge state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: n_z_transport
field.documentation: Transport coefficients of for the density of the charge state considered (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: d
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity. The 2nd index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions.

field.name: v
field.documentation: Effective convection. The 2nd index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions.

field.name: t_z_transport
field.documentation: Transport coefficients of for the energy of the charge state considered

field.name: d
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity

field.name: v
field.documentation: Effective convection

IDS.name: em_coupling
IDS.documentation: Description of the axisymmetric mutual electromagnetics; does not include non-axisymmetric coil systems; the convention is Quantity_Sensor_Source

field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: mutual_active_active
field.documentation: Mutual inductance coupling from active coils to active coils

field.name: mutual_passive_active
field.documentation: Mutual inductance coupling from active coils to passive loops

field.name: mutual_loops_active
field.documentation: Mutual inductance coupling from active coils to poloidal flux loops

field.name: field_probes_active
field.documentation: Poloidal field coupling from active coils to poloidal field probes

field.name: mutual_passive_passive
field.documentation: Mutual inductance coupling from passive loops to passive loops

field.name: mutual_loops_passive
field.documentation: Mutual inductance coupling from passive loops to poloidal flux loops

field.name: field_probes_passive
field.documentation: Poloidal field coupling from passive loops to poloidal field probes

field.name: mutual_grid_grid
field.documentation: Mutual inductance from equilibrium grid to itself

field.name: mutual_grid_active
field.documentation: Mutual inductance coupling from active coils to equilibrium grid

field.name: mutual_grid_passive
field.documentation: Mutual inductance coupling from passive loops to equilibrium grid

field.name: field_probes_grid
field.documentation: Poloidal field coupling from equilibrium grid to poloidal field probes

field.name: mutual_loops_grid
field.documentation: Mutual inductance from equilibrium grid to poloidal flux loops

field.name: active_coils
field.documentation: List of the names of the active PF+CS coils

field.name: passive_loops
field.documentation: List of the names of the passive loops

field.name: poloidal_probes
field.documentation: List of the names of poloidal field probes

field.name: flux_loops
field.documentation: List of the names of the axisymmetric flux loops

field.name: grid_points
field.documentation: List of the names of the plasma region grid points

field.name: code
field.documentation: Generic decription of the code specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: version
field.documentation: Version of the code

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

field.name: output_diagnostics
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output in XML format

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

IDS.name: equilibrium
IDS.documentation: Description of a 2D, axi-symmetric, tokamak equilibrium; result of an equilibrium code.

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: status_of
field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.name: comment_of
field.documentation: Any additional comment from the source application

field.name: creator_of
field.documentation: Creator of this consistent IDS

field.name: date_of
field.documentation: Date of consistent creation of this IDS

field.name: source_of
field.documentation: Where do the data for this IDS come from (a procedure, a set of codes)

field.name: reference_of
field.documentation: Documented reference to this IDS data

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: boundary
field.documentation: Description of the plasma boundary

field.name: type
field.documentation: 0 (limiter) or 1 (diverted)

field.name: lcfs
field.documentation: RZ description of the plasma boundary. The second dimension is oversized to fit the maximum number of (R,Z) points over the time range

field.name: n_points
field.documentation: Number of meaningful points in R and Z at a given time. R and Z are matrices oversized on their first dimension (max(N_Points)).

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: geometric_axis
field.documentation: RZ position of the geometric axis (defined as (Rmin+Rmax) / 2 of the boundary)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: a_minor
field.documentation: Minor radius of the plasma boundary (defined as (Rmax-Rmin) / 2 of the boundary)

field.name: elongation
field.documentation: Elongation of the plasma boundary

field.name: elongation_upper
field.documentation: Elongation (upper half w.r.t. geometric axis) of the plasma boundary

field.name: elongation_lower
field.documentation: Elongation (lower half w.r.t. geometric axis) of the plasma boundary

field.name: triangularity_upper
field.documentation: Upper triangularity of the plasma boundary

field.name: triangularity_lower
field.documentation: Lower triangularity of the plasma boundary

field.name: n_x_points
field.documentation: Number of X points at a given time

field.name: x_point_inner
field.documentation: RZ position of the innermost X point, the active X point if diverted.

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: x_point_outer
field.documentation: RZ position of the second Xpoint

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: strike_point_lower_left
field.documentation: RZ position of the lower left strike point

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: strike_point_upper_left
field.documentation: RZ position of the upper left strike point

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: strike_point_lower_right
field.documentation: RZ position of the lower right strike point

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: strike_point_upper_right
field.documentation: RZ position of the upper right strike point

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: active_limiter_point
field.documentation: RZ position of the active limiter point (point of the plasma boundary in contact with the limiter)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: global_quantities
field.documentation: 0D parameters of the equilibrium

field.name: beta_pol
field.documentation: Poloidal beta

field.name: beta_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal beta

field.name: beta_normal
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal beta

field.name: ip
field.documentation: Plasma current. Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above.

field.name: li_3
field.documentation: Internal inductance

field.name: volume
field.documentation: Total plasma volume

field.name: area
field.documentation: Area of the LCFS poloidal cross section

field.name: psi_axis
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the magnetic axis

field.name: psi_boundary
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the selected plasma boundary

field.name: magnetic_axis
field.documentation: Magnetic axis position

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: b_tor_axis
field.documentation: Total toroidal magnetic field at the magnetic axis

field.name: q_axis
field.documentation: q at the magnetic axis

field.name: q_95
field.documentation: q at the 95% poloidal flux surface

field.name: q_min
field.documentation: Minimum q value in the plasma

field.name: vacuum_toroidal_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at b0; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product r0*b0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

field.name: w_mhd
field.documentation: Plasma energy content = 3/2 * int(p,dV) with p being the total pressure (thermal + fast particles) [J]. Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: gamma
field.documentation: Adiabatic index

field.name: profiles_1d
field.documentation: Equilibrium profiles (1D radial grid) as a function of the poloidal flux

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux, such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal flux

field.name: f
field.documentation: Diamagnetic function (F=R B_Phi)

field.name: dpressure_dpsi
field.documentation: Derivative of Pressure w.r.t. Psi

field.name: f_df_dpsi
field.documentation: Derivative of F w.r.t. Psi, multiplied with F

field.name: j_tor
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged toroidal current density = average(J_TorR) / average(1/R)

field.name: j_parallel
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged parallel current density = average(j.B) / B0, where B0 = Equilibrium/Global/Toroidal_Field/B0

field.name: q
field.documentation: Safety factor

field.name: magnetic_shear
field.documentation: Magnetic shear

field.name: r_inboard
field.documentation: Radial coordinate (major radius) on the inboard side of the magnetic axis

field.name: r_outboard
field.documentation: Radial coordinate (major radius) on the outboard side of the magnetic axis

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate, defined as sqrt(Phi/pi/B0), where B0 = Equilibrium/Global/Toroidal_Field/B0

field.name: dpsi_drho_tor
field.documentation: Derivative of Psi with respect to Rho_Tor

field.name: rho_vol_norm
field.documentation: Normalised radial coordinate related to the plasma volume. Defined as sqrt(volume / volume[LCFS])

field.name: triangularity_upper
field.documentation: Upper triangularity w.r.t. magnetic axis

field.name: triangularity_lower
field.documentation: Lower triangularity w.r.t. magnetic axis

field.name: volume
field.documentation: Volume enclosed in the flux surface

field.name: dvolume_dpsi
field.documentation: Radial derivative of the volume enclosed in the flux surface with respect to Psi

field.name: dvolume_drho_tor
field.documentation: Radial derivative of the volume enclosed in the flux surface with respect to Rho_Tor

field.name: area
field.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface

field.name: darea_dpsi
field.documentation: Radial derivative of the cross-sectional area of the flux surface with respect to Psi

field.name: surface
field.documentation: Surface area of the toroidal flux surface

field.name: trapped_fraction
field.documentation: Trapped particle fraction

field.name: gm1
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged 1/R^2

field.name: gm2
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged grad_rho^2/R^2

field.name: gm3
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged grad_rho^2

field.name: gm4
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged 1/B^2

field.name: gm5
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged B^2

field.name: gm6
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged grad_rho^2/B^2

field.name: gm7
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged grad_rho

field.name: gm8
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged R

field.name: gm9
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged 1/R

field.name: b_average
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged B

field.name: b_min
field.documentation: Minimum(B) on the flux surface

field.name: b_max
field.documentation: Maximum(B) on the flux surface

field.name: profiles_2d
field.documentation: Equilibrium 2D profiles in the poloidal plane. Multiple 2D representations of the equilibrium can be stored here.

field.name: grid_type
field.documentation: Selection of one of a set of grid types. 1-rectangular (R,Z) grid, in this case the position arrays should not be filled since they are redundant with grid/dim1 and dim2.

field.name: grid
field.documentation: Definition of the 2D grid

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First dimension values

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second dimension values

field.name: r
field.documentation: Values of the major radius on the grid

field.name: z
field.documentation: Values of the Height on the grid

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Values of the poloidal flux at the grid in the poloidal plane

field.name: theta
field.documentation: Values of the poloidal angle on the grid

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal flux

field.name: j_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal plasma current density

field.name: j_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel (to magnetic field) plasma current density

field.name: b_r
field.documentation: R component of the poloidal magnetic field

field.name: b_z
field.documentation: Z component of the poloidal magnetic field

field.name: b_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal component of the magnetic field

field.name: coordinate_system
field.documentation: Flux surface coordinate system on a square grid of flux and poloidal angle

field.name: grid_type
field.documentation: Type of coordinate system

field.name: grid
field.documentation: Definition of the 2D grid

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First dimension values

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second dimension values

field.name: r
field.documentation: Values of the major radius on the grid

field.name: z
field.documentation: Values of the Height on the grid

field.name: jacobian
field.documentation: Jacobian of the coordinate system

field.name: g_11
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_11; g_ij=g^ij are contravariant metric tensor for the grid described by grid_type

field.name: g_12
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_12; g_ij=g^ij are contravariant metric tensor for the grid described by grid_type

field.name: g_13
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_13; g_ij=g^ij are contravariant metric tensor for the grid described by grid_type

field.name: g_22
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_22; g_ij=g^ij are contravariant metric tensor for the grid described by grid_type

field.name: g_23
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_23; g_ij=g^ij are contravariant metric tensor for the grid described by grid_type

field.name: g_33
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_33; g_ij=g^ij are contravariant metric tensor for the grid described by grid_type

field.name: code
field.documentation: Generic decription of the code specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: parameters

field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: flux_loop
field.documentation: Flux loops; partial flux loops can be described

field.name: position
field.documentation: List of (R,Z,phi) points defining the position of the loop (see data structure documentation FLUXLOOPposition.pdf)

field.documentation: Toroidal angle

field.name: flux
field.documentation: Measured flux

field.name: bpol_probe

field.documentation: Name of the probe

field.name: identifier
field.documentation: ID of the probe

field.name: position
field.documentation: R, Z, Phi position of the coil centre

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle

field.name: poloidal_angle
field.documentation: Poloidal angle of the coil orientation

field.name: toroidal_angle
field.documentation: Toroidal angle of coil orientation (0 if fully in the poloidal plane)

field.name: area
field.documentation: Area of each turn of the coil

field.name: length
field.documentation: Length of the coil

field.name: turns
field.documentation: Turns in the coil, including sign

field.name: field
field.documentation: Measured magnetic field

field.name: data
field.documentation: Measured magnetic field

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: method
field.documentation: A method generating processed quantities derived from the magnetic measurements

field.name: name

field.name: ip
field.documentation: Plasma current. Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above

field.name: data
field.documentation: Plasma current. Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above

IDS.name: pf_active
IDS.documentation: Description of the axisymmetric active poloidal field (PF) coils and supplies; includes the limits of these systems; includes the forces on them; does not include non-axisymmetric coil systems

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: status_of
field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.name: comment_of
field.documentation: Any additional comment from the source application

field.name: creator_of
field.documentation: Creator of this consistent IDS

field.name: date_of
field.documentation: Date of consistent creation of this IDS

field.name: source_of
field.documentation: Where do the data for this IDS come from (a procedure, a set of codes)

field.name: reference_of
field.documentation: Documented reference to this IDS data

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: coil
field.documentation: Active PF coils

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the coil

field.name: identifier
field.documentation: Alphanumeric identifier of coils used for convenience

field.name: resistance
field.documentation: Coil resistance

field.name: energy_limit_max
field.documentation: Maximum Energy to be dissipated in the coil

field.name: element
field.documentation: Each PF coil is comprised of a number of cross-section elements described individually

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of this element of this coil

field.name: identifier
field.documentation: Identifier of this element of this coil

field.name: turns_with_sign
field.documentation: Number of effective turns in the element for calculating magnetic fields of the coil; includes the sign of the number of turns

field.name: area
field.documentation: Cross-sectional areas of the element

field.name: geometry
field.documentation: Cross-sectional shape of the element

field.name: geometry_type
field.documentation: Type used to describe the element shape (0 for 'Coordinates_RZ' or 1 for 'RZDRDZ')

field.name: outline
field.documentation: Irregular outline of the element

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: rectangle
field.documentation: Rectangular description of the element

field.name: r
field.documentation: Geometric centre R

field.name: z
field.documentation: Geometric centre Z

field.name: width
field.documentation: Horizontal full width

field.name: height
field.documentation: Vertical full height

field.name: oblique
field.documentation: Rectangular description of the element

field.name: r
field.documentation: Geometric centre R

field.name: z
field.documentation: Geometric centre Z

field.name: alpha
field.documentation: Inclination of first angle TBD

field.name: beta
field.documentation: Inclination of second angle TBD

field.name: current
field.documentation: Current in the coil

field.name: data
field.documentation: Current in the coil

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: voltage
field.documentation: Voltage on the coil terminals

field.name: data
field.documentation: Voltage on the coil terminals

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: vertical_force
field.documentation: Vertical forces on the axisymmetric PF coil system

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the force combination

field.name: combination
field.documentation: Coils involved in the force combinations. Normally the vertical force would be the full set of coils, but in some cases, we want to have a difference in forces, such as a CS coil separation force. We therefore give each coil a force weight which we call the combination

field.name: limit_max
field.documentation: Vertical force combination limit

field.name: limit_min
field.documentation: Vertical force combination limit

field.name: force
field.documentation: Force

field.name: data
field.documentation: Force

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: circuit
field.documentation: Circuits, connecting multiple PF coils to multiple supplies, defining the current and voltage relationships in the system

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the circuit

field.name: identifier
field.documentation: ID of the circuit

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of the circuit

field.name: connections
field.documentation: Description of the supplies and coils connections (nodes) across the circuit. The matrix describing for each node (first dimension) which components are connected to it (1 if connected, 0 otherwise). There are 2 sides to each component, thus 2*ncomponents as the size of the second dimension, listing first all supplies, then all coils (in the same order as listed in SUPPLIES and COILS). An example can be found in the data structure documentation PFconnections.pdf (TBD)

field.name: voltage
field.documentation: Voltage on the circuit

field.name: data
field.documentation: Voltage on the circuit

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: current
field.documentation: Current in the circuit

field.name: data
field.documentation: Current in the circuit

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: supply
field.documentation: PF power supplies

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the PF supply

field.name: identifier
field.documentation: Identifier of the supply

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of the supply; TBD add free description of non-linear power supplies

field.name: resistance
field.documentation: Power supply internal resistance

field.name: delay
field.documentation: Pure delay in the supply

field.name: filter_numerator
field.documentation: Coefficients of the numerator, in increasing order : a0 + a1*s + ... + an*s^n; used for a linear supply description

field.name: filter_denominator
field.documentation: Coefficients of the denominator, in increasing order : b0 + b1*s + ... + bm*s^m; used for a linear supply description

field.name: current_limit_max
field.documentation: Maximum current in the supply

field.name: current_limit_min
field.documentation: Minimum current in the supply

field.name: voltage_limit_max
field.documentation: Maximum voltage from the supply

field.name: voltage_limit_min
field.documentation: Minimum voltage from the supply

field.name: current_limiter_gain
field.documentation: Gain to prevent overcurrent in a linear model of the supply

field.name: energy_limit_max
field.documentation: Maximum energy to be dissipated in the supply during a pulse

field.name: nonlinear_model
field.documentation: Description of the nonlinear transfer function of the supply

field.name: voltage
field.documentation: Voltage at the supply output

field.name: data
field.documentation: Voltage at the supply output

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: current
field.documentation: Current at the supply output, defined positive if it flows from point 1 to point 2 of the component in the pfcircuit description

field.name: data
field.documentation: Current at the supply output, defined positive if it flows from point 1 to point 2 of the component in the pfcircuit description

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.documentation: Generic decription of the code specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

field.name: date_of
field.documentation: Date of consistent creation of this IDS

field.name: source_of
field.documentation: Where do the data for this IDS come from (a procedure, a set of codes)

field.name: reference_of
field.documentation: Documented reference to this IDS data

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: waveform
field.documentation: Reference waveform to be used to drive feedback or feedforward controllers, or to control the controller switching itself

field.name: name
field.documentation: Reference name

field.name: value
field.documentation: Values of the reference for the timebase

field.name: data
field.documentation: Values of the reference for the timebase

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

IDS.name: sdn
IDS.documentation: Description of the Synchronous Data Network parameters and the signals on it

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: status_of
field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.name: comment_of
field.documentation: Any additional comment from the source application

field.name: creator_of
field.documentation: Creator of this consistent IDS

field.name: date_of
field.documentation: Date of consistent creation of this IDS

field.name: source_of
field.documentation: Where do the data for this IDS come from (a procedure, a set of codes)

field.name: reference_of
field.documentation: Documented reference to this IDS data

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: signal
field.documentation: Dictionary of the signal names and definitions which can be allocated to the SDN

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the allocatable signal

field.name: definition
field.documentation: Definition of the allocatable signal

field.name: ip_normalise
field.documentation: 0 or 1 if this signal is multiplied by Ip to generate a control variable; this usage is specific to magnetic control, but could be extended to other control loops

field.name: allocated_position
field.documentation: Allocation of signal to a position in the SDN (1..N); this will be implementation specific

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value

field.name: topic_list
field.documentation: List of the groups of signals used at different reading and writing points; this is an implementation detail which might change

field.name: names
field.documentation: Names of the group of SDN signals

field.name: indices
field.documentation: Indices into the current SDN allocated list; it must be updated when the allocated list is changed

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

IDS.name: simulation
IDS.documentation: Simulation parameters for a general simulation

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: status_of
field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.name: comment_of
field.documentation: Any additional comment from the source application

field.name: creator_of
field.documentation: Creator of this consistent IDS

field.name: date_of
field.documentation: Date of consistent creation of this IDS

field.name: source_of
field.documentation: Where do the data for this IDS come from (a procedure, a set of codes)

field.name: reference_of
field.documentation: Documented reference to this IDS data

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: comment_before
field.documentation: Comment made when launching a simulation

field.name: comment_after
field.documentation: Comment made at the end of a simulation

field.name: time_begin
field.documentation: Start time

field.name: time_step
field.documentation: Time interval between steps

field.name: time_end
field.documentation: Stop time

field.name: time_restart
field.documentation: Time to restart an old simulation

field.name: time_begun
field.documentation: Actual wall-clock time simulation started

field.name: time_ended
field.documentation: Actual wall-clock time simulation finished

field.name: time_pf_supplies_start
field.documentation: Time to enable PF supply limits

field.name: iterations_max
field.documentation: Maximum number of simulation loops allowed

field.name: iterations_used
field.documentation: Number of simulation loops used

field.name: termination_condition
field.documentation: Expression to terminate the simulation, to be written in the platform language in the for or if (condition) terminate

field.name: rate_plot_equilibrium
field.documentation: Plot the 2D images each N iterations

field.name: device_name
field.documentation: Name of the device being simulated

field.name: restart_simulation
field.documentation: Identifier of the simulation to be restarted

IDS.name: tf
IDS.documentation: Toroidal field coils (all assumed to be identical). If individual description of coil is needed, use the same description as in pf IDS.

field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: status_of
field.documentation: Status of this structure 'OK' if the structure was created consistently, 'partial' if not complete, 'inconsistent' if complete but not guaranteed consistent

field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS

field.name: coil
field.documentation: Number of coils around the tokamak

field.name: turns
field.documentation: Number of total turns in a toroidal field coil

field.name: current
field.documentation: Current in the coil

field.name: data
field.documentation: Current in the coil

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: voltage
field.documentation: Voltage on the coil terminals

field.name: data
field.documentation: Voltage on the coil terminals

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: b_tor_vacuum_r
field.documentation: Vacuum field times major radius in the toroidal field magnet. Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above

field.name: data
field.documentation: Vacuum field times major radius in the toroidal field magnet. Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]
